item.title: Tree covered in dog bags, 27th November
item.description:
On a tree outside and to the right of Thomas Tallis School, there is a tree that someone has been dumping what looks like over 50 bags of dog poo. It has now been like this for over a month and looks absolutely disgusting. All of the children walking to and from school must walk past this everyday.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kidbrooke Park Road, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Regular Littering on Sandringham Road, 27th November
item.description:
I watched a woman (who lived in one of the houses pictured) drop this pile of trash at the tree and then walk away. Sandringham is constantly littered from people doing this. I asked her why she didn't use the bin and she shrugged.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sandringham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned van on Amberley road, 27th November
item.description:
This white Vauxhall van DU62 GZY seems to have been abandoned on Amberley Road near the junction with Glenview. It has been parked in the same spot for at least 6 weeks and has damage down the side so I'm not sure if it's been stolen and dumped or something. Just checked on the government website and it's not taxed either.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Amberley Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins attitude!, 27th November
item.description:
Some bus stops having tow bins other zero can you explain this please? What a mystery! At some parts of long walk home no bins at all where big pond is! In general problems with private and partly private, councils with bulky items collections! Next next to cctv!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marine Street, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti sprayed on shutter next to a residential home. Location 26 Sidney road SW9 0TS., 27th November
item.description:
I like to report graffiti sprayed on a shutter next to a residents home at 26 Sidney road SW9 0TS. The graffiti is in both black and red spray paint against a silver shutter. Please can the graffiti be jet sprayed off. The graffiti has been there for over one month.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Sidney Road, Stockwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pendennis Road, Streatham, Greater London

item.title: Insurance, benefits and navigation, time scale and attitude!, 27th November
item.description:
So many dogs. not enough space for them! Who is giving permission? No ball games for kids as no play yards! New school with 3 or 2 floors! New flats to try to get it as second ones as where to have them! 3/4 beds with reasonable prices and not for those only with 0 kids none officially and those with 3/4 or less where and those who can afford well..... Where space for me in this as last few well.... Make sure to check lights, pick up trash and trim trees in time and check street with correct cars parking around and insurance and rest of benefits too!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marine Street, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
